Account.name: Account
Account.description: Represents an account passed into the Account Manager on Glass.

Attachment.name: Attachment
Attachment.description: Represents media content, such as a photo, that can be attached to a timeline item.

isProcessingContent.name: isProcessingContent
isProcessingContent.description: Indicates that the contentUrl is not available because the attachment content is still being processed. If the caller wishes to retrieve the content, it should try again later.

contentType.name: contentType
contentType.description: The MIME type of the attachment.

AttachmentsListResponse.name: AttachmentsListResponse
AttachmentsListResponse.description: A list of Attachments. This is the response from the server to GET requests on the attachments collection.

kind.name: kind
kind.description: The type of resource. This is always mirror#attachmentsList.

Command.name: Command
Command.description: A single menu command that is part of a Contact.

type.name: type
type.description:
The type of operation this command corresponds to. Allowed values are:  
- TAKE_A_NOTE - Shares a timeline item with the transcription of user speech from the "Take a note" voice menu command.  
- POST_AN_UPDATE - Shares a timeline item with the transcription of user speech from the "Post an update" voice menu command.

Contact.name: Contact
Contact.description: A person or group that can be used as a creator or a contact.

acceptTypes.name: acceptTypes
acceptTypes.description: A list of MIME types that a contact supports. The contact will be shown to the user if any of its acceptTypes matches any of the types of the attachments on the item. If no acceptTypes are given, the contact will be shown for all items.

phoneNumber.name: phoneNumber
phoneNumber.description: Primary phone number for the contact. This can be a fully-qualified number, with country calling code and area code, or a local number.

acceptCommands.name: acceptCommands
acceptCommands.description: A list of voice menu commands that a contact can handle. Glass shows up to three contacts for each voice menu command. If there are more than that, the three contacts with the highest priority are shown for that particular command.

displayName.name: displayName
displayName.description: The name to display for this contact.

kind.name: kind
kind.description: The type of resource. This is always mirror#contact.

speakableName.name: speakableName
speakableName.description: Name of this contact as it should be pronounced. If this contact's name must be spoken as part of a voice disambiguation menu, this name is used as the expected pronunciation. This is useful for contact names with unpronounceable characters or whose display spelling is otherwise not phonetic.

imageUrls.name: imageUrls
imageUrls.description: Set of image URLs to display for a contact. Most contacts will have a single image, but a "group" contact may include up to 8 image URLs and they will be resized and cropped into a mosaic on the client.

id.name: id
id.description: An ID for this contact. This is generated by the application and is treated as an opaque token.

source.name: source
source.description: The ID of the application that created this contact. This is populated by the API

priority.name: priority
priority.description: Priority for the contact to determine ordering in a list of contacts. Contacts with higher priorities will be shown before ones with lower priorities.

type.name: type
type.description:
The type for this contact. This is used for sorting in UIs. Allowed values are:  
- INDIVIDUAL - Represents a single person. This is the default. 
- GROUP - Represents more than a single person.

sharingFeatures.name: sharingFeatures
sharingFeatures.description:
A list of sharing features that a contact can handle. Allowed values are:  
- ADD_CAPTION

ContactsListResponse.name: ContactsListResponse
ContactsListResponse.description: A list of Contacts representing contacts. This is the response from the server to GET requests on the contacts collection.

kind.name: kind
kind.description: The type of resource. This is always mirror#contacts.

Location.name: Location
Location.description: A geographic location that can be associated with a timeline item.

address.name: address
address.description: The full address of the location.

displayName.name: displayName
displayName.description: The name to be displayed. This may be a business name or a user-defined place, such as "Home".

kind.name: kind
kind.description: The type of resource. This is always mirror#location.

accuracy.name: accuracy
accuracy.description: The accuracy of the location fix in meters.

timestamp.name: timestamp
timestamp.description: The time at which this location was captured, formatted according to RFC 3339.

LocationsListResponse.name: LocationsListResponse
LocationsListResponse.description: A list of Locations. This is the response from the server to GET requests on the locations collection.

kind.name: kind
kind.description: The type of resource. This is always mirror#locationsList.

MenuItem.name: MenuItem
MenuItem.description: A custom menu item that can be presented to the user by a timeline item.

payload.name: payload
payload.description:
A generic payload whose meaning changes depending on this MenuItem's action.  
- When the action is OPEN_URI, the payload is the URL of the website to view. 
- When the action is PLAY_VIDEO, the payload is the streaming URL of the video 
- When the action is GET_MEDIA_INPUT, the payload is the text transcription of a user's speech input

removeWhenSelected.name: removeWhenSelected
removeWhenSelected.description: If set to true on a CUSTOM menu item, that item will be removed from the menu after it is selected.

values.name: values
values.description: For CUSTOM items, a list of values controlling the appearance of the menu item in each of its states. A value for the DEFAULT state must be provided. If the PENDING or CONFIRMED states are missing, they will not be shown.

action.name: action
action.description:
Controls the behavior when the user picks the menu option. Allowed values are:  
- CUSTOM - Custom action set by the service. When the user selects this menuItem, the API triggers a notification to your callbackUrl with the userActions.type set to CUSTOM and the userActions.payload set to the ID of this menu item. This is the default value. 
- Built-in actions:  
- REPLY - Initiate a reply to the timeline item using the voice recording UI. The creator attribute must be set in the timeline item for this menu to be available. 
- REPLY_ALL - Same behavior as REPLY. The original timeline item's recipients will be added to the reply item. 
- DELETE - Delete the timeline item. 
- SHARE - Share the timeline item with the available contacts. 
- READ_ALOUD - Read the timeline item's speakableText aloud; if this field is not set, read the text field; if none of those fields are set, this menu item is ignored. 
- GET_MEDIA_INPUT - Allow users to provide media payloads to Glassware from a menu item (currently, only transcribed text from voice input is supported). Subscribe to notifications when users invoke this menu item to receive the timeline item ID. Retrieve the media from the timeline item in the payload property. 
- VOICE_CALL - Initiate a phone call using the timeline item's creator.phoneNumber attribute as recipient. 
- NAVIGATE - Navigate to the timeline item's location. 
- TOGGLE_PINNED - Toggle the isPinned state of the timeline item. 
- OPEN_URI - Open the payload of the menu item in the browser. 
- PLAY_VIDEO - Open the payload of the menu item in the Glass video player. 
- SEND_MESSAGE - Initiate sending a message to the timeline item's creator:  
- If the creator.phoneNumber is set and Glass is connected to an Android phone, the message is an SMS. 
- Otherwise, if the creator.email is set, the message is an email.

id.name: id
id.description: The ID for this menu item. This is generated by the application and is treated as an opaque token.

contextual_command.name: contextual_command
contextual_command.description: The ContextualMenus.Command associated with this MenuItem (e.g. READ_ALOUD). The voice label for this command will be displayed in the voice menu and the touch label will be displayed in the touch menu. Note that the default menu value's display name will be overriden if you specify this property. Values that do not correspond to a ContextualMenus.Command name will be ignored.

MenuValue.name: MenuValue
MenuValue.description: A single value that is part of a MenuItem.

displayName.name: displayName
displayName.description: The name to display for the menu item. If you specify this property for a built-in menu item, the default contextual voice command for that menu item is not shown.

iconUrl.name: iconUrl
iconUrl.description: URL of an icon to display with the menu item.

state.name: state
state.description:
The state that this value applies to. Allowed values are:  
- DEFAULT - Default value shown when displayed in the menuItems list. 
- PENDING - Value shown when the menuItem has been selected by the user but can still be cancelled. 
- CONFIRMED - Value shown when the menuItem has been selected by the user and can no longer be cancelled.

Notification.name: Notification
Notification.description: A notification delivered by the API.

userActions.name: userActions
userActions.description: A list of actions taken by the user that triggered the notification.

itemId.name: itemId
itemId.description: The ID of the item that generated the notification.

userToken.name: userToken
userToken.description: The user token provided by the service when it subscribed for notifications.

verifyToken.name: verifyToken
verifyToken.description: The secret verify token provided by the service when it subscribed for notifications.

collection.name: collection
collection.description: The collection that generated the notification.

operation.name: operation
operation.description: The type of operation that generated the notification.

NotificationConfig.name: NotificationConfig
NotificationConfig.description: Controls how notifications for a timeline item are presented to the user.

deliveryTime.name: deliveryTime
deliveryTime.description: The time at which the notification should be delivered.

level.name: level
level.description:
Describes how important the notification is. Allowed values are:  
- DEFAULT - Notifications of default importance. A chime will be played to alert users.

kind.name: kind
kind.description: The type of resource. This is always mirror#setting.

id.name: id
id.description:
The setting's ID. The following IDs are valid:  
- locale - The key to the user’s language/locale (BCP 47 identifier) that Glassware should use to render localized content.  
- timezone - The key to the user’s current time zone region as defined in the tz database. Example: America/Los_Angeles.

value.name: value
value.description: The setting value, as a string.

Subscription.name: Subscription
Subscription.description: A subscription to events on a collection.

userToken.name: userToken
userToken.description: An opaque token sent to the subscriber in notifications so that it can determine the ID of the user.

verifyToken.name: verifyToken
verifyToken.description: A secret token sent to the subscriber in notifications so that it can verify that the notification was generated by Google.

kind.name: kind
kind.description: The type of resource. This is always mirror#subscription.

callbackUrl.name: callbackUrl
callbackUrl.description: The URL where notifications should be delivered (must start with https://).

collection.name: collection
collection.description:
The collection to subscribe to. Allowed values are:  
- timeline - Changes in the timeline including insertion, deletion, and updates. 
- locations - Location updates. 
- settings - Settings updates.

operation.name: operation
operation.description:
A list of operations that should be subscribed to. An empty list indicates that all operations on the collection should be subscribed to. Allowed values are:  
- UPDATE - The item has been updated. 
- INSERT - A new item has been inserted. 
- DELETE - The item has been deleted. 
- MENU_ACTION - A custom menu item has been triggered by the user.

updated.name: updated
updated.description: The time at which this subscription was last modified, formatted according to RFC 3339.

SubscriptionsListResponse.name: SubscriptionsListResponse
SubscriptionsListResponse.description: A list of Subscriptions. This is the response from the server to GET requests on the subscription collection.

kind.name: kind
kind.description: The type of resource. This is always mirror#subscriptionsList.

TimelineItem.name: TimelineItem
TimelineItem.description: Each item in the user's timeline is represented as a TimelineItem JSON structure, described below.

displayTime.name: displayTime
displayTime.description: The time that should be displayed when this item is viewed in the timeline, formatted according to RFC 3339. This user's timeline is sorted chronologically on display time, so this will also determine where the item is displayed in the timeline. If not set by the service, the display time defaults to the updated time.

attachments.name: attachments
attachments.description: A list of media attachments associated with this item. As a convenience, you can refer to attachments in your HTML payloads with the attachment or cid scheme. For example: - attachment: where attachment_index is the 0-based index of this array. - cid: where attachment_id is the ID of the attachment.

isBundleCover.name: isBundleCover
isBundleCover.description:
Whether this item is a bundle cover.

If an item is marked as a bundle cover, it will be the entry point to the bundle of items that have the same bundleId as that item. It will be shown only on the main timeline — not within the opened bundle.

On the main timeline, items that are shown are:  
- Items that have isBundleCover set to true  
- Items that do not have a bundleId  In a bundle sub-timeline, items that are shown are:  
- Items that have the bundleId in question AND isBundleCover set to false

sourceItemId.name: sourceItemId
sourceItemId.description: Opaque string you can use to map a timeline item to data in your own service.

speakableText.name: speakableText
speakableText.description:
The speakable version of the content of this item. Along with the READ_ALOUD menu item, use this field to provide text that would be clearer when read aloud, or to provide extended information to what is displayed visually on Glass.

Glassware should also specify the speakableType field, which will be spoken before this text in cases where the additional context is useful, for example when the user requests that the item be read aloud following a notification.

isDeleted.name: isDeleted
isDeleted.description: When true, indicates this item is deleted, and only the ID property is set.

html.name: html
html.description:
HTML content for this item. If both text and html are provided for an item, the html will be rendered in the timeline.
Allowed HTML elements - You can use these elements in your timeline cards.
 
- Headers: h1, h2, h3, h4, h5, h6 
- Images: img 
- Lists: li, ol, ul 
- HTML5 semantics: article, aside, details, figure, figcaption, footer, header, nav, section, summary, time 
- Structural: blockquote, br, div, hr, p, span 
- Style: b, big, center, em, i, u, s, small, strike, strong, style, sub, sup 
- Tables: table, tbody, td, tfoot, th, thead, tr  
Blocked HTML elements: These elements and their contents are removed from HTML payloads.
 
- Document headers: head, title 
- Embeds: audio, embed, object, source, video 
- Frames: frame, frameset 
- Scripting: applet, script  
Other elements: Any elements that aren't listed are removed, but their contents are preserved.

pinScore.name: pinScore
pinScore.description: For pinned items, this determines the order in which the item is displayed in the timeline, with a higher score appearing closer to the clock. Note: setting this field is currently not supported.

id.name: id
id.description: The ID of the timeline item. This is unique within a user's timeline.

canonicalUrl.name: canonicalUrl
canonicalUrl.description: A canonical URL pointing to the canonical/high quality version of the data represented by the timeline item.

isPinned.name: isPinned
isPinned.description: When true, indicates this item is pinned, which means it's grouped alongside "active" items like navigation and hangouts, on the opposite side of the home screen from historical (non-pinned) timeline items. You can allow the user to toggle the value of this property with the TOGGLE_PINNED built-in menu item.

created.name: created
created.description: The time at which this item was created, formatted according to RFC 3339.

kind.name: kind
kind.description: The type of resource. This is always mirror#timelineItem.

bundleId.name: bundleId
bundleId.description: The bundle ID for this item. Services can specify a bundleId to group many items together. They appear under a single top-level item on the device.

inReplyTo.name: inReplyTo
inReplyTo.description: If this item was generated as a reply to another item, this field will be set to the ID of the item being replied to. This can be used to attach a reply to the appropriate conversation or post.

menuItems.name: menuItems
menuItems.description: A list of menu items that will be presented to the user when this item is selected in the timeline.

selfLink.name: selfLink
selfLink.description: A URL that can be used to retrieve this item.

speakableType.name: speakableType
speakableType.description:
A speakable description of the type of this item. This will be announced to the user prior to reading the content of the item in cases where the additional context is useful, for example when the user requests that the item be read aloud following a notification.

This should be a short, simple noun phrase such as "Email", "Text message", or "Daily Planet News Update".

Glassware are encouraged to populate this field for every timeline item, even if the item does not contain speakableText or text so that the user can learn the type of the item without looking at the screen.

recipients.name: recipients
recipients.description: A list of users or groups that this item has been shared with.

updated.name: updated
updated.description: The time at which this item was last modified, formatted according to RFC 3339.

TimelineListResponse.name: TimelineListResponse
TimelineListResponse.description: A list of timeline items. This is the response from the server to GET requests on the timeline collection.

kind.name: kind
kind.description: The type of resource. This is always mirror#timeline.

nextPageToken.name: nextPageToken
nextPageToken.description: The next page token. Provide this as the pageToken parameter in the request to retrieve the next page of results.

UserAction.name: UserAction
UserAction.description: Represents an action taken by the user that triggered a notification.

payload.name: payload
payload.description:
An optional payload for the action.

For actions of type CUSTOM, this is the ID of the custom menu item that was selected.

type.name: type
type.description:
The type of action. The value of this can be:  
- SHARE - the user shared an item. 
- REPLY - the user replied to an item. 
- REPLY_ALL - the user replied to all recipients of an item. 
- CUSTOM - the user selected a custom menu item on the timeline item. 
- DELETE - the user deleted the item. 
- PIN - the user pinned the item. 
- UNPIN - the user unpinned the item. 
- LAUNCH - the user initiated a voice command.  In the future, additional types may be added. UserActions with unrecognized types should be ignored.

quotaUser.name: quotaUser
quotaUser.description: Available to use for quota purposes for server-side applications. Can be any arbitrary string assigned to a user, but should not exceed 40 characters. Overrides userIp if both are provided.

prettyPrint.name: prettyPrint
prettyPrint.description: Returns response with indentations and line breaks.

userIp.name: userIp
userIp.description: IP address of the site where the request originates. Use this if you want to enforce per-user limits.

fields.name: fields
fields.description: Selector specifying which fields to include in a partial response.

structuredValue: View and manage your Glass timeline
commons.OathScopeDescriptions.name: commons.OathScopeDescriptions

oath2.name: oath2
oath2.description: Google Oath2.0 authorization. Detailed documentation can be found at https://developers.google.com/identity/protocols/OAuth2

methods.description: Gets a single setting by ID.

id.name: id
id.description:
The ID of the setting. The following IDs are valid: 
- locale - The key to the user’s language/locale (BCP 47 identifier) that Glassware should use to render localized content. 
- timezone - The key to the user’s current time zone region as defined in the tz database. Example: America/Los_Angeles.

methods.description: Creates a new subscription.
Retrieves a list of subscriptions for the authenticated user and service.
Updates an existing subscription in place.
Deletes a subscription.
Inserts a new item into the timeline.

pinnedOnly.name: pinnedOnly
pinnedOnly.description: If true, only pinned items will be returned.

maxResults.name: maxResults
maxResults.description: The maximum number of items to include in the response, used for paging.

sourceItemId.name: sourceItemId
sourceItemId.description: If provided, only items with the given sourceItemId will be returned.

bundleId.name: bundleId
bundleId.description: If provided, only items with the given bundleId will be returned.

includeDeleted.name: includeDeleted
includeDeleted.description: If true, tombstone records for deleted items will be returned.

structuredValue: Results will be ordered by displayTime (default). This is the same ordering as is used in the timeline on the device.
Results will be ordered by the time at which they were last written to the data store.
commons.EnumDescriptions.name: commons.EnumDescriptions

orderBy.name: orderBy
orderBy.description: Controls the order in which timeline items are returned.

pageToken.name: pageToken
pageToken.description: Token for the page of results to return.

methods.description: Retrieves a list of timeline items for the authenticated user.
Updates a timeline item in place. This method supports patch semantics.
Gets a single timeline item by ID.
Updates a timeline item in place.
Deletes a timeline item.

id.name: id
id.description: The ID of the timeline item.

itemId.name: itemId
itemId.description: The ID of the timeline item the attachment belongs to.

methods.description: Adds a new attachment to a timeline item.
Returns a list of attachments for a timeline item.
Retrieves an attachment on a timeline item by item ID and attachment ID.
Deletes an attachment from a timeline item.
Retrieves a list of locations for the user.
Gets a single location by ID.

id.name: id
id.description: The ID of the location or latest for the last known location.

accountType.name: accountType
accountType.description: Account type to be passed to Android Account Manager.

methods.description: Inserts a new account for a user

accountName.name: accountName
accountName.description: The name of the account to be passed to the Android Account Manager.

methods.description: Inserts a new contact.
Retrieves a list of contacts for the authenticated user.
Updates a contact in place. This method supports patch semantics.
Gets a single contact by ID.
Updates a contact in place.
Deletes a contact.
